article.title: NGC 307 and the Effects of Dark-Matter Haloes on Measuring Supermassive Black Holes in Disc Galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the top panel of Figure 1 show?
choices: A close-up of the central bulge region of NGC 307.
The distribution of dark matter in NGC 307.
Logarithmically scaled isophotes of NGC 307, revealing a possible disc embedded within a rounder halo.

multiple_choice_question.text: What feature of NGC 307 is highlighted by the label in Figure 2?
choices: A possible bar or lens within the disc.
The location of the supermassive black hole.
A region of active star formation.
The equation for calculating the mass of a supermassive black hole.
The penalized χ² function used in the maximum penalized likelihood (MPL) method for fitting LOSVDs.
The formula for determining the stellar mass-to-light ratio.
The equation for calculating the gravitational potential of a dark matter halo.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the lower panel of Figure 12 show?
choices: The difference between the observed and model surface brightness profiles along the major axis of NGC 307.
The distribution of dark matter along the major axis of NGC 307.
The stellar velocity dispersion profile along the major axis of NGC 307.
The age and metallicity profiles along the major axis of NGC 307.
